page.title: 10Timber Yard
page.content: John Steyning -Timber merchant {Local History}This firm was founded in 1792 by John Steyning.The site at Brightling Road was acquired around 1885 to gain easy acces to the railway. {Industry}Until 1947 the numbers employed in the sawmill were approximately 15.The machinery was relatively simple,powered by steam.In 1947 a modern band-mill was installed and all machinery was electrically driven.Further expansion took place in the early 1960's when adjoining land was purchased.The enlarged and modernised mill employed up to 80 people and was capable of cutting up to 20,000 cubic feet of round timber per week. {Economics}The economic climate recently has cut output and therefore employment.Trade is mostly oak-board.
